data.title: Who will deliver my pieces?
data.description: We deliver your pieces with a member of our experience style concierge. All of our style concierges are trained aside with each of our brand partners to insure you receive the fullest luxury experience, comfortably and stress free.

data.title: How long do I have to try my pieces?
data.description: Your stylist will arrive within your chosen one-hour window from then you will have 40 minutes to try and make a decision. Don’t worry, 40 minutes is a comfortable amount of time as on average 14 minutes is usually spent in a fitting room.

data.title: Does the Style Concierge come into my home?
data.description: Depending on which option you choose, ‘we wait you try’ or ‘assist me’. We wait you try: Your stylist will deliver your pieces, you will then have 40 minutes to try. When you have chosen the pieces you would like to keep, just simply pay and we take back the unsold items for you. Assist me: Your stylist will unpack your pieces and help you throught out your appointment with any styling advice and any tailoring if needed.

data.title: Is there any obligation to buy?
data.description: Simply no. Emays helps you to find pieces you love, while making it easier to return the pieces you don’t — saving you time and effort. We want to make you feel confident and comfortable in your choices, without any pressure to buy.

data.title: How can I modify my appointment?
data.description: Please contact Emays customer service team by emailing info@emaysstyle.com.

privacy.title: PRIVACY POLICY
privacy.content:
Emays srl, with registered office in Corso Italia 22, 20122 Milan (MI), Fiscal Code 1260201010964, registered in the Milan Monza Brianza Company Register under REA MI – 2671764, ("Emays" ) as Data Controller of personal data ( "Owner"), in his capacity as owner of the website, www.emaysstyle.com (the " Site ") and of the Emays mobile application ("App.") pursuant to articles 4, no. 7) and 26 of EU Regulation 2016/679 of 27 April 2016 concerning the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data ("EU Regulation") informs you pursuant to art. 13 of the EU Regulation that I am the owner of your personal data and that he will proceed with the related processing for the purposes and with the methods indicated below.

By processing of personal data we mean any operation or set of operations, performed with the aid of automated processes and applied to personal data or sets of personal data, such as the collection, registration, organization, structuring, conservation, adaptation or modification, extraction, consultation, use, communication by transmission, diffusion or any other form of making available, comparison or interconnection, limitation, cancellation or destruction.

The use of the Site, the App. or any of our Services presupposes the prior acceptance of this Information.

Emays respects and protects the privacy of visitors, making every possible and proportionate effort not to infringe on users' rights. We inform you that such data will be processed with the support of IT or telematic means for the following purposes.

A.Purpose of data processing personal data and legal basis

1.The data provided by the registered and unregistered user will be processed, without the prior consent of the User pursuant to art. 6 EU Regulation, for the following purposes:

  • for the management and processing of statistical surveys on the use of the Site;
  • to carry out the maintenance and technical assistance necessary to ensure the correct functioning of the Site and the services connected to it;
  • to improve the quality and structure of the Site, as well as to create new services, functions and/or characteristics of the same;
  • to process any contact request forwarded by the User by filling in the appropriate form or by email, e.g. to obtain clarifications on the services offered;
  • to carry out an effective management of the contractual relationship and to fulfill the legal and contractual obligations deriving from the same as a contract for the provision of services and to collect payments;
  • to allow the Data Controller to exercise his rights in court and repress unlawful conduct;
  • to fulfill legal or regulatory obligations.

2.The data provided by the user will be processed, subject to his consent, which will be distinct, specific and separate for each point of this paragraph, pursuant to art. 6 EU Regulation, for the following purposes:

  • to allow the sending of commercial, promotional and advertising communications by means of automated systems, such as e-mails on products, initiatives and/or services offered by the newsletter holder containing insights into the main topics related to fashion.

B.Communication and dissemination of personal data for the pursuit of the purposes of the treatment

With reference to the art. 13, paragraph 1, letter (e) of the EU Regulation, the subjects or categories of subjects who may become aware of the user's personal data as managers or agents are indicated and a specific list by category is provided below :

  • staff of the Data Controller assigned to administrative management activities and to commercial, marketing and logistic service activities;
  • in charge of the maintenance and/or repair of IT tools;
  • in charge of surveys and provision of services;
  • Labor consultants and/or accountant firms, as managers;
  • professionals and consultants of the Owner;
  • companies operating in the transport, logistics and shipping sector.

Furthermore, for the pursuit of the purposes indicated in point A. the data may be communicated to any other third party when the communication is mandatory by law or by the contract for the provision of services.

The computer systems and software procedures used to operate the Site or the App acquire, during their normal operation, some personal data whose transmission is implicit in the use of Internet communication protocols. This information is not collected to be associated with identified interested parties, but which by their very nature could, through processing and association with data held by third parties, allow users to be identified.

This category of data includes the IP addresses or domain names of the computers used by users who connect to the Site or App., the addresses in URI ( Uniform Resource Identifier ) notation of the requested resources, the time of the request, possibly the number of clicks, the method used to submit the request to the server, the size of the file obtained in response, the numerical code indicating the status of the response given by the server (success, error...) and other parameters relating to the operating system and to the user's computer environment.

For security purposes (spam filters, firewalls, virus detection), the data relating to the IP address could be used, in accordance with the laws in force on the subject, in order to block attempts to damage the Site or the App. or to cause damage to other users, or in any case harmful activities or activities constituting a crime.

The data mentioned are never used for the identification or profiling of the user, but only for the purpose of providing information on the use of the Site or the App. and to check its correct functioning and are canceled immediately after processing.

On each occasion of contact with or during the registration of a personal account with our company, you may collect further personal information, for example, your contact information; information on personal characteristics, country of residence, ID card number and date and place of issue; purchase history, payment information, such as your payment card number and other card information, as well as authentication information and other billing and account details; your preferences, subject to your written consent, regarding marketing and communication; as well as in relation to its purchases.

C.Transfer of personal data

This Site or App may share some of the data collected with services located outside the European Union area through the use of providers appointed as data processors.

In this context, personal data will be transferred to the United States, in accordance with existing international agreements and the Standard Contractual Clauses, which the European Commission considers offer sufficient guarantees for the international transfer of data.

Outside of this case, the management and storage of data will take place on servers located within the European Union

D.Data retention times and others information.

In compliance with the principles of lawfulness, purpose limitation and data minimization, pursuant to art. 5 of EU Regulation no. 2016/679, personal data will be kept for the period of time necessary to achieve the purposes for which they were collected (registration, delivery, billing, etc.).

Registration for and related data processing takes place until the user cancels it.

The data collected for promotional purposes will be kept in our database until the interested party exercises the right of opposition or cancellation through the methods made available for this purpose and indicated on the Site or anela App. and in this disclosure.

E.Withdrawal of consent and opposition

In the event that the interested party gives his consent to authorize the Data Controller to pursue the purposes referred to in point A.2, the interested party will in any case remain free to revoke it at any time, by sending a clear communication without any formalities in this sense to the email: info@emaysstyle.com . Following receipt of this request, the Data Controller will be responsible for promptly removing and deleting the data from the databases used for the aforementioned purpose and informing any third parties to whom the data has been communicated for the same purposes of deletion. The mere receipt of the cancellation request will automatically be valid as confirmation of the cancellation.

We inform you specifically and separately, as required by art. 21 of the EU Regulation that if personal data are processed for direct marketing purposes, the interested party has the right to object at any time to the processing of personal data concerning him carried out for these purposes and that if the interested party opposes the treatment for direct marketing purposes, personal data can no longer be processed for these purposes.

F.Methods of treatment

The processing of data for the purposes set out takes place with automated methods, on electronic or magnetic support, in compliance with the rules of confidentiality and security established by law, by the consequent regulations and by internal provisions.

The data will be processed by subjects authorized to carry out the tasks referred to in point A, constantly identified, suitably instructed and made aware of the security obligations established by internal regulations, by the EU Regulation and prepared by the Data Controller.

G.Owner and Managers of treatment

The identification details of the Data Controller are as follows:

  • Emays srl, with registered office in Corso Italia 22, 20122 Milan (MI), Fiscal Code 1260201010964, registered in the Milan Monza Brianza Company Register under REA MI – 2671764,
  • e-mail: info@emaysstyle.com

The updated list of Data Processors is made available upon request by the interested party to be forwarded to the Data Controller at the following e-mail address: info@emaysstyle.com

H.Exercise of rights by of the interested party

Pursuant to articles 13, paragraph 2, letters (b) and (d), 15, 18, 19 and 21 of the EU Regulation, the interested party is informed that he has the right to:

  • ask for confirmation of the existence or otherwise of your personal data;
  • obtain information about the purposes of the processing, the categories of personal data, the recipients or categories of recipients to whom the personal data have been or will be communicated and, when possible, the retention period;
  • obtain the rectification and cancellation of data;
  • obtain the limitation of the treatment or oppose the treatment;
  • obtain data portability, i.e. receive them from a data controller, in a structured format, commonly used and readable by an automatic device, and transmit them to another data controller without impediments;
  • revoke the consent at any time without prejudice to the lawfulness of the treatment based on the consent given before the revocation;
  • propose a complaint to the Guarantor for the protection of personal data, following the procedures and indications published on the official website of the Authority at www.garanteprivacy.it;

Any rectifications or cancellations or limitations to the processing carried out at the request of the interested party - unless this proves impossible or involves a disproportionate effort - will be communicated by the Data Controller to each of the recipients to whom the personal data have been transmitted. The Data Controller may communicate these recipients to the interested party if the interested party requests it.

The exercise of rights is not subject to any form constraint and is free and can be exercised by sending an e-mail to info@emaysstyle.com

For convenience, articles 15 to 23 of the EU Regulation can be consulted at this link:https://eur-lex.europa.eu/legal-content/IT/TXT/?uri=celex%3A32016R0679

I.Information not contained in this Privacy Policy and amendments

Further information in relation to the processing of personal data may be requested at any time from the Data Controller using the contact information.

The Data Controller reserves the right to make changes to this Privacy Policy at any time by giving notice to users on this page. Therefore, please consult this page often, referring to the date of the last modification indicated at the bottom. In the event of non-acceptance of the changes made to this Privacy Policy, the user is required to cease using the site and can request the Data Controller to remove his personal data.

J.Defense in court

The user's personal data can be used for the defense by the Data Controller in court or in the preparatory stages for its eventual establishment, against abuses in the use of the site and related services by the user or to defend our company in the possibility of legal action against us or for another purpose dictated by law.

The user declares to be aware that the Data Controller may be required to disclose data at the request of the Public Authorities.

cookie.title: COOKIE POLICIES
cookie.content:
This page describes how to manage the Website with reference to the use of cookies and the related processing of personal data of users who consult it.

Cookies are small text files that the sites visited send to the user's terminal (desktop, tablet, smartphone, notebook), where they are stored, and then re-transmitted to the same sites on the next visit. They are used to perform computer authentication, session monitoring and storing information on sites (without the use of 'technical' cookies some operations would be very complex or impossible to perform). During navigation on a site, the user can also receive cookies on his terminal that are sent from different sites or web servers (so-called 'third parties'), on which some elements may reside (such as, for example, images, maps, sounds, specific links to pages of other domains) present on the site that the user is visiting.

The cookies we use are divided into the following categories:



  • Technical cookies



    Cookies of this type are necessary to guarantee navigation on the Site, to ensure the correct functioning of some areas of the Site and to improve the User experience. Furthermore, they make it possible to distinguish between the various connected users in order to provide a service requested by the User, and for reasons of site security. Consent is not required for these cookies. These cookies can be divided into:

    • Session cookies , which guarantee normal navigation and use of the Site (allowing, for example, authentication to access restricted areas). They are not used for other purposes and are normally installed directly by the owner or operator of the website (so-called "proprietary cookies").



    • Persistent cookies, which remain stored on the hard disk of the User's device until they expire or are canceled by visiting users. Through persistent cookies, Visitor Users who access the Site (or any other Users who use the same computer) are automatically recognized at each visit. Persistent cookies satisfy many functions in the interest of surfers (such as, for example, the use of the navigation language). Visitor Users can set the browser of their computer or device in such a way that it accepts/rejects all cookies or displays a warning whenever a cookie is proposed, in order to be able to evaluate whether to accept it or not. However, the User is enabled to modify the predefined configuration (default) and disable cookies (ie block them definitively), setting the highest level of protection.



    The aforementioned types of cookies (session and persistent) can in turn be:



    • "owners" when they are managed directly by the owner and/or manager of the Site; in the specific case by the Owner;

      • or

    • of "third parties" when cookies are set up and managed by managers unrelated to the Site. This Site has no control over cookies entirely managed by third parties and does not have access to the information collected through these cookies. This type of cookie falls under the direct and exclusive responsibility of the same third party. The information on the use of these cookies and on their purposes, as well as on the methods for disabling them, are provided directly by the third parties.



    • Proprietary cookies



    • Proprietary cookies are created and controlled by our website. They may include cookies that personalize content, track user preferences, and provide analytics data to help us improve our services. These cookies may also be used for targeted advertising purposes.

    • How can cookies be disabled?



    • Each web browser allows you to limit and delete cookies. Below we report some purely indicative information on the procedure necessary to disable cookies, depending on the browser used by the User.



    • Internet Explorer 8.0+: Click on “Tools” in the menu bar and select “Internet Options”



    • Click on the “Privacy” tab at the top Drag the slider to “Block all cookies”



    • Firefox 4.0+: Click on "Tools" in the menu bar



    • Select “Options”



    • Click on the “Privacy” tab



    • Check the box “Activate the anti-tracking of personal data”



    • Chrome: Click on the “Chrome Menu” in the browser toolbar Select “Settings”



    • Click on “Show advanced settings”



    • In the Privacy section, click on the “Content settings” button



    • In the “Cookies” section select “Ignore the exceptions and block the setting of third-party cookies”



    • Safari 5.0: Click on the Safari menu and select “Preferences”



    • Click on the “Security” tab.



    • In the “Accept cookies” section, specify whether to accept cookies always, never or only from the sites visited. For an explanation of the different options, click the question mark Help button. If Safari is set to block cookies, you may need to temporarily accept them before the page opens.
